context: The Estonian word 'kahte' is the partitive singular and illative singular form of the numeral 'kaks' (meaning 'two'). In the partitive case, it indicates an incomplete or indefinite quantity - 'some two units'. In the illative case, it indicates motion toward something - 'to two (places/things)'. This word is commonly used when referring to a countable but unspecified number of items or movement toward multiple destinations.
